definition: empty-handed/unarmed/(painting, embroidery etc) without following a model/(abbr. for 空手道[kong1 shou3 dao4]) karate
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to return empty-handed/to fail to win anything

sentences.english: Strolling the flower market for two rounds, yet I ended up coming back with hands empty.
sentences.chinese: 把花市逛了兩圈，仍然空手而回。

sentences.english: It is the ancestor of karate and ju-jitsu.
sentences.chinese: 功夫起源於中國，是空手道和柔術的祖先。

sentences.english: Then am I to go back empty-handed?
Buddha asked him how he came back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 佛祖問他怎麼空手回來了？
絕對不要空手去任何地方。

sentences.english: We came to this world with nothing in our hands.
sentences.chinese: 我們來到這世是空手而來。

sentences.english: Then the marines came out empty-handed.
The black belt is the highest level in karate.
sentences.chinese: 黑腰帶級是空手道的最高級別。

sentences.english: Injections of tens of thousands take medicine, go out empty-handed back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 打針吃藥好幾萬，空手出門空手返。

sentences.english: Injections of tens of thousands take medicine, go out empty-handed back empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 打針吃藥好幾萬，空手出門空手返。

sentences.english: If I go back empty-handed, I might be coming back to you soon to ask for a job.
sentences.chinese: 如果我空手回去，大概很快就會來找你要份工作囉。

sentences.english: Do this at the appointed time in the month of Abib, for in that month you came out of Egypt. "No one is to appear before me empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 誰也不可空手朝見我，因爲你是這月出了埃及。
最後只有五個家庭空手而歸。

sentences.english: No one shall appear before me empty-handed.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都不應出現在我面前空手而歸。

sentences.english: I have competed in bodybuilding and karate.
sentences.chinese: 我參加鍛鍊身體和空手道的比賽了。

sentences.english: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
sentences.chinese: 你打發寡婦空手回去，折斷孤兒的膀臂。

definition: empty hand, empty fist (idiom); having nothing to rely on/unarmed and defenseless
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
